Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-16T18:13:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-04
  • City: MILWAUKEE
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On January 4, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN2922 was damaged during transit and released approximately two and a half (2.5) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EnviroServe (ES) to remediate the impacted site. Crews deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and worked them in with hand tools. The damaged pail, all UN2922 impacted materials, and spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal purposes.

  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal NOF experienced a UN1992 Pro Form Lacquer Thinner Fast 19122 release from a 5-gallon steel drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1 cup of product released to a 2’ x 2’ area of cardboard on the floor due to a puncture caused by other freight as a result of improper loading. The release was contained to cardboard. The damaged pail and impacted cardboard were collected into a 55-gallon metal drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024010096
item.description:
Report E-2024010096

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-16T18:13:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-03
  • City: FREDERICK
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: LANDSTAR SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On January 3, 2024, at 0225 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Frederick, Maryland regarding the release of approximately 4 gallons of CINCHONA FLUID EXTRACT (UN1170, 3, II) from (1) 5-gallon plastic pail. The release was caused by a crack in the bottom of the pail and contained to a small area on the trailer floor and a 1’ x 1' area of asphalt beneath the trailer. Contractors were able to clean the release with absorbents and the proper PPE. The damaged pail containing product was placed in an overpack and forwarded on to the original consignee. All waste generated from addressing this release was containerized in (1) 55-gallon DM and taken offsite by contractors for proper disposal.

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The container arrived at Veolia's 10 Day In-transit facility located at 24 Commerce Parkway, Fredericksburg, VA 22406 on 12/29/2023. As it was transferred from the original delivering vehicle to the outbound vehicle on 1/4/24, a leak was discovered. The material was transferred to another IBC that was UN rated for the material. Investigation revealed that there was a crack directly behind the valve. It was determined that this was most likely caused by freezing due to the weather.

  • Description: CONTENTS OF TWO PACKAGES WERE INSPECTED DUE TO BEING COLD TO THE TOUCH AND HAD FROST FORMING. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED APPROXIMATELY 40 LBS OF DRY ICE PELLETS COOLING CANINE PARVOVIRUS MONOCLONAL ANTIBODY. ADDITIONAL TRACKING NUMBER TO ANOTHER CONSIGNEE IN THE USA IS 1ZB8F4990150330932. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOXES. ONE BOX HAS A FREEZE UPON ARRIVAL BLUE STICKER APPLIED. THESE PACKAGES HAVE NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

item.title: Report E-2024010107
item.description:
Report E-2024010107

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-12T18:13:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-03
  • City: HENDERSON
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal UDV experienced a UN2929 Sulfix 9272 Scavenger release from (2) 330-gallon poly totes. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 70-gallons of product released to a 10’ x 10’ area of the trailer floor and a 20’ x 20’ area of the asphalt lot below. The totes were punctured by metal sticking out from the trailer wall. Each tote was transferred into two new totes for shipment on. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted areas. The impacted absorbents were then collected into (2) 55-gallon poly, (3) 55-gallon metal, and (3) 95-gallon poly drums. The two damaged totes were then cut up and containerized into (1) 95-gallon poly and (1) 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: 1. X-2024010286 SequenceEvent: HAP specialist was going through the unload bank when he spotted the damaged hazmat sitting on the rollers on its side. the package was leaking a slow dribble onto the floor. He called the HESS specialist to ask for a lined tote and cleanup material to perform immediate in-house cleanup. upon completion, HESS specialist brought the package in a lined tote back to the damage area and moved it to the drain mats in the incoming damaged hazmat/LQ area. DescribePack: one bottle leaked due to loose cap. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: immediate in-house cleanup. placed in lined tote, moved to drain mats. 2. X-2024010289 SequenceEvent: HAP specialist discovered this damaged hazmat at the same time as the package in Hazmat Incident No.117328, in the unload. He called HESS specialist to bring him a lined tote and cleanup material. HESS specialist did as requested, then took from him the damaged hazmat in its tote and brought this back to the damage area, placing it atop the drain mats in the incoming damaged hazmat/LQ area. DescribePack: two bottles leaked due to loose caps DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: immediate in-house cleanup performed. placed in lined tote, moved to drain mats. 3. X-2024010300 SequenceEvent: HAP specialist discovered this package in the unload when placing several other damaged hazmats into lined totes for the HESS specialist to bring back to the damage area. As this was in the same MPS as the others and found in the same trailer, HAP specialist elected to have it inspected just in case. HESS specialist placed the package's tote atop the drain mats in the incoming damaged hazmat/LQ area. The following day, HESS specialist inspected the contents and found that one bottle had leaked. DescribePack: one bottle leaked due to loose cap DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: placed in lined tote, moved to drain mats. 4. X-2024010302 SequenceEvent: HAP specialist discovered this package in the unload when placing several other damaged hazmats into lined totes for the HESS specialist to bring back to the damage area. As this was in the same MPS as the others and found in the same trailer, HAP specialist elected to have it inspected just in case. HESS specialist placed the package's tote atop the drain mats in the incoming damaged hazmat/LQ area. The following day, HESS specialist inspected the contents and found that one bottle had leaked. DescribePack: one bottle leaked due to loose cap DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: placed in lined tote, moved to drain mats.

  • Carrier/Reporter: UNION PACIFIC RAILROAD COMPANY INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Car found to be leaking from the bottom outlet cap at a rate of 2-3 gallons per minute. Upon arrival of the contractor, Code 3, the valve handle was in the closed, pinned, and sealed position and the bottom outlet cap was less than tool tight. Code 3 tightened the cap, stopping the release. After the car was set out, the contractor was able to climb under the car and determined that the valve was in the open position even with the handle closed. The handle was dropped to the open position, engaged, and the valve closed. The BOV plug was removed and verified the valve was closed with no release. The shipper was contacted and an OTMA was requested before the car would be released into transportation.

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-11T15:12:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-20
  • City: RICHFIELD
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Hepaco was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 70ft-by-20ft area of the concrete terminal floor and estimated that seventy (70) gallons of material was released due to forklift damaging one (1) 275-gallon poly tote. Hepaco personnel deployed a neutralizer to the impacted area while on SCBA and later respirators and later once the neutralizing had been completed an absorbent was used to gather the spent material. Hepaco personnel recovered the spent material and containerized it into eight (8) 55-gallon poly drums. The remaining product in the damaged tote was transferred to a new tote and the damaged 275-gallon poly tote was cut up and placed into one (1) 55- gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite in a secure location prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-11T15:12:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-16
  • City: PARKERSBURG
  • State: WV
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On December 16, 2023, at approximately 14:24 hours, personnel at the CSX Parkersburg, WV yard reported an odor of gas coming from the area of tank TILX 305535, residue: last contained Isoprene, stabilized. SPSI, a CSXT response contractor, responded and found TILX 305535 leaking from the top of the tank car. The tank car was isolated and the Shipper, Kraton Corp, was notified via CHEMTREC (Report 2023-1216-00057). SPSI inspected the railcar and found the sample line valve not fully closed and the secondary closure plug less than tool tight. The issue was identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shipper’s representative- Kel Fann (904-239-2238, Michael.Fann@kraton.com). Contractor personnel closed the sample line valve and secured the secondary closure plug. The car was released for transportation.

item.title: Report E-2024010119
item.description:
Report E-2024010119

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-10T15:11:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-29
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On December 29, 2023, one (1) 300-gallon tote of NA1993 was damaged during loading and released approximately 150-gallons of product to the trailer interior, pavement below, and the loading dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from TPM Group (TPM) to remediate the impacted site. TPM personnel deployed granular absorbent to the impacted trailer floor, dock floor and pavement below trailer and worked them in utilizing hand tools. Crews then utilized a vacuum pump to transfer the virgin product from the damaged tote to a new tote and secured for normal transport. All NA1993 impacted material was collected and containerized in four (4) 55-gallon drums and RLC personnel took possession of the four (4) 55-gallon drums and one (1) damaged 275-gallon tote to be added to the facility waste stream.

item.title: Report I-2023110039
item.description:
Report I-2023110039

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-12T00:37:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-04
  • City: BALTIMORE
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: RSI LEASING, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 10.4.23 at approximately 7:45am, during a transfer of Ferric Chloride from railcar(PVSX213032) into All-Chem trailer (FRP64) the air valve on the trailer malfunctioned causing a release. The loader immediately climbed down from the railcar and closed both the internal and external valves on the trailer. Approximately 2 gallons of product was released, notifications were made to proper NS, RSI, PVS and All-Chem personnel. Hepaco arrived on site around 12pm, cleaned up, removed all debris and departed around 2:15pm.
